alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:32PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso County through 615 PM MDT... At 532 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Carson, or 8 miles south of Colorado Springs, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Security-Widefield around 535 PM MDT. Colorado Springs, Fountain, Fort Carson and Security around 540 PM MDT. Stratmoor around 545 PM MDT. Peterson AFB around 550 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Manitou Springs and Cimarron Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
